Sergio Marchionne said he wanted to introduce profit-sharing plans for Fiat's Italian workers, while stressing we have to make profits( at the plants), before we can share them. The car manufacturer met fierce opposition from the Italian General Confederation of Labor and its engineering workers' arm over the Turin agreement, which union officials said they considered an attack on labor rights.
